intro: Pistorinia hispanica var. brachysiphon, commonly known as the Spanish pistorinia, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
